abstract.text: Creates a new query for a series of the specified quantity type.

HealthKit returns quantities in ascending order, based on their start date.

abstract.text: An expression to evalutate if a conditional expression’s predicate evaluates to true.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
An object that stores a value for a given unit.
A sample that represents a quantity, including the value and the units.
A query that accesses the series data associated with a quantity sample.
A Boolean value that determines whether the query should return the series sample.
Creates a new query for a series of the specified quantity type.
A Boolean value that determines whether the query groups the results based on the quantity sample’s start date.
A type that identifies samples that store numerical values.
Returns a predicate that matches an object with the specified universally unique identifier (UUID).
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A definition of logical conditions for constraining a search for a fetch or for in-memory filtering.
The span of time between a specific start date and end date.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
